conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for your message and for your continued interest in Nursery_C.

At this stage, with one place remaining, we are still holding capacity in case a higher-priority family (relative to our published priority order) submits an application and is eligible to take the place. In that sense, the realistic scenario in which we could offer you the remaining place would be if higher-priority families do not apply to Nursery_C (or do not finalize enrollment if offered) by the point we must confirm placements.

Regarding your question about documentation: additional documents typically help us confirm eligibility but do not change a family’s position in the priority order unless they establish a priority category that was not previously verified.

If you wish, you may check back again closer to the confirmation point this cycle; however, I also encourage you to continue pursuing your other preferred options in parallel so you are not left without a placement.

Sincerely,
Nursery_C Admissions

Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for your continued patience and for checking in.

At a high level, we are still keeping the final place uncommitted while we allow time for any higher-priority families (per our published priority order) to come forward and complete the process. For privacy reasons, we can’t confirm whether any specific families are actively in progress, but I can share our general timeline:

- We plan to review/confirm this remaining place on a rolling basis through the next few rounds, with a firm decision point approaching shortly.
- If no higher-priority eligible family applies and is ready to finalize by that confirmation point, we would then consider the next families in the priority order.

If you would like to remain in consideration, the most helpful step is to stay ready to submit/confirm promptly if we notify you that the place can be offered to you. In parallel, we still recommend pursuing your other options so you are not left without a placement.

Sincerely,
Nursery_C Admissions

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for your message and for staying ready.

1) **Timing / outreach:** If we reach the **end of Round 13** without being able to finalize with a higher-priority eligible family, we expect to begin contacting the next families in priority order **immediately after Round 13 closes / at the start of Round 14**. The confirmation window is typically **short (about 24 hours or one round, depending on timing)** so we can finalize promptly.

2) **File status / readiness:** I can note your continued interest and that you are prepared to confirm immediately; however, we generally can’t certify a file as “complete/eligible” until the required documents have been received and verified. If you would like, you may send your **preferred email and a rapid-response phone number** (and any standard documents you already have prepared) so there is no delay if we are able to move to you.

As shared previously, we are still keeping the place uncommitted through the end of Round 13 in case a higher-priority family applies and is ready to finalize.

Sincerely,
Nursery_C Admissions

conversation.message:

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E Admissions,

Thank you for your Round 23 application and for your continued interest in Nursery_C.

At this time, we are **not able to offer you the remaining place**, as we are still holding the seat for any **higher-priority** eligible family (per our published priority order) that may apply and be ready to finalize.

**Updated decision point / timeline:** we will keep the remaining place uncommitted through the **end of Round 25**. If we reach the end of Round 25 without finalizing with a higher-priority eligible family, we will then begin outreach to the next families in priority order **at the start of Round 26**, using your rapid-response contacts:
- parent.e@example.com
- +1-555-0100

If an offer is issued, it will come with a **short confirmation window (typically about one round / ~24 hours)**.

Sincerely,
Nursery_C Admissions

Each of these parents ranks Nursery_C relatively highly (Parent_B: 2nd; Parent_C: 2nd but is lowest on our list; Parent_A and Parent_D rank Nursery_C last), so Parent_B is the most plausible higher-priority applicant who could still arrive. Accepting Parent_E now would forgo the chance to match with Parent_B (or Parent_A/Parent_D) if they apply later. Given the mechanism (parents choose one nursery each round) and that we can prefer to keep the seat unfilled rather than accept a lower-priority parent, we should continue to hold capacity. Provide an updated timeline to manage expectations while rejecting the application as required by rules.

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for your Round 24 application and for confirming you can finalize immediately.

At this time, we are **not able to offer you the remaining place**. We are still holding the seat through the **end of Round 25** in case a **higher-priority** eligible family (per our published priority order) applies and is ready to finalize.

On your questions:
- **Confirmation deadline (if an offer is issued):** if we are able to issue you an offer later (e.g., at the start of Round 26 if we move down the list), the confirmation window would be **one round / approximately 24 hours** from the time the offer is sent.
- **Documents (requested only if an offer is issued):** we would typically request (1) child ID/birth certificate, (2) parent/guardian ID, (3) proof of address, (4) immunization/health record as applicable, and (5) required consent/emergency contact forms.

If we reach the end of Round 25 without finalizing with a higher-priority family and we are able to move further down the priority list, we will contact you promptly using:
- parent.e@example.com
- +1-555-0100

Sincerely,
Nursery_C Admissions

[REJECT]
